meanings.definition: Straps: narrow strip of leather or other material used for fastening or securing something
meanings.sent1: The backpack had sturdy straps for carrying books.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the straps on her sandals before heading out.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the straps of the purse.
meanings.sent4: His determination was the strap that held the team together.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's straps gleamed in the sunlight as he rushed into the burning building.

meanings.definition: Straps: to fasten or secure with straps
meanings.sent1: He straps his helmet tightly before riding his bike.
meanings.sent2: She straps her seatbelt on before starting the car.
meanings.sent3: The chef straps the apron around his waist before starting to cook.
meanings.sent4: She straps her emotions tightly, not letting anyone see her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut straps into the rocket, ready for the journey into space.

meanings.definition: Straps: to beat with a strap as a punishment
meanings.sent1: In the olden days, teachers would strap students for misbehaving.
meanings.sent2: The cruel master would strap the poor horse for the smallest mistake.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous boy joked that he would strap his friend if he didn't stop laughing.
meanings.sent4: The harsh wind seemed to strap the trees, bending them to its will.
meanings.sent5: The storm's fury was like a giant hand ready to strap the land with its power.
